children.name: Active Listening
children.description: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

children.name: Mathematics
children.description: Using mathematics to solve problems.

children.name: Reading Comprehension
children.description: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

children.name: Science
children.description: Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

children.name: Speaking
children.description: Talking to others to convey information effectively.

children.name: Writing
children.description: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

children.name: Active Learning
children.description: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

children.name: Critical Thinking
children.description: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.

children.name: Learning Strategies
children.description: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

children.name: Monitoring
children.description: Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

children.name: Complex Problem Solving
children.description: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

children.name: Management of Financial Resources
children.description: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

children.name: Management of Material Resources
children.description: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

children.name: Management of Personnel Resources
children.description: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.

children.name: Time Management
children.description: Managing one's own time and the time of others.

children.name: Coordination
children.description: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

children.name: Instructing
children.description: Teaching others how to do something.

children.name: Negotiation
children.description: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

children.name: Persuasion
children.description: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

children.name: Service Orientation
children.description: Actively looking for ways to help people.

children.name: Social Perceptiveness
children.description: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

children.name: Judgment and Decision Making
children.description: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

children.name: Systems Analysis
children.description: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

children.name: Systems Evaluation
children.description: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

children.name: Equipment Maintenance
children.description: Performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

children.name: Equipment Selection
children.description: Determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

children.name: Installation
children.description: Installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

children.name: Operation and Control
children.description: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

children.name: Operation Monitoring
children.description: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

children.name: Operations Analysis
children.description: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

children.name: Programming
children.description: Writing computer programs for various purposes.

children.name: Quality Control Analysis
children.description: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

children.name: Repairing
children.description: Repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

children.name: Technology Design
children.description: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

children.name: Troubleshooting
children.description: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

children.name: Selective Attention
children.description: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

children.name: Time Sharing
children.description: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information (such as speech, sounds, touch, or other sources).

children.name: Category Flexibility
children.description: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways.

children.name: Deductive Reasoning
children.description: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

children.name: Fluency of Ideas
children.description: The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

children.name: Inductive Reasoning
children.description: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).

children.name: Information Ordering
children.description: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).

children.name: Originality
children.description: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.

children.name: Problem Sensitivity
children.description: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.

children.name: Memorization
children.description: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, and procedures.

children.name: Flexibility of Closure
children.description: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern (a figure, object, word, or sound) that is hidden in other distracting material.

children.name: Perceptual Speed
children.description: The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns. The things to be compared may be presented at the same time or one after the other. This ability also includes comparing a presented object with a remembered object.

children.name: Speed of Closure
children.description: The ability to quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.

children.name: Mathematical Reasoning
children.description: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

children.name: Number Facility
children.description: The ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and correctly.

children.name: Spatial Orientation
children.description: The ability to know your location in relation to the environment or to know where other objects are in relation to you.

children.name: Visualization
children.description: The ability to imagine how something will look after it is moved around or when its parts are moved or rearranged.

children.name: Oral Comprehension
children.description: The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

children.name: Oral Expression
children.description: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

children.name: Written Comprehension
children.description: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

children.name: Written Expression
children.description: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.

children.name: Control Precision
children.description: The ability to quickly and repeatedly adjust the controls of a machine or a vehicle to exact positions.

children.name: Multilimb Coordination
children.description: The ability to coordinate two or more limbs (for example, two arms, two legs, or one leg and one arm) while sitting, standing, or lying down. It does not involve performing the activities while the whole body is in motion.

children.name: Rate Control
children.description: The ability to time your movements or the movement of a piece of equipment in anticipation of changes in the speed and/or direction of a moving object or scene.

children.name: Response Orientation
children.description: The ability to choose quickly between two or more movements in response to two or more different signals (lights, sounds, pictures). It includes the speed with which the correct response is started with the hand, foot, or other body part.

children.name: Arm-Hand Steadiness
children.description: The ability to keep your hand and arm steady while moving your arm or while holding your arm and hand in one position.

children.name: Finger Dexterity
children.description: The ability to make precisely coordinated movements of the fingers of one or both hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble very small objects.

children.name: Manual Dexterity
children.description: The ability to quickly move your hand, your hand together with your arm, or your two hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble objects.

children.name: Reaction Time
children.description: The ability to quickly respond (with the hand, finger, or foot) to a signal (sound, light, picture) when it appears.

children.name: Speed of Limb Movement
children.description: The ability to quickly move the arms and legs.

children.name: Wrist-Finger Speed
children.description: The ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists.

children.name: Dynamic Flexibility
children.description: The ability to quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out with your body, arms, and/or legs.

children.name: Extent Flexibility
children.description: The ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms, and/or legs.

children.name: Gross Body Coordination
children.description: The ability to coordinate the movement of your arms, legs, and torso together when the whole body is in motion.

children.name: Gross Body Equilibrium
children.description: The ability to keep or regain your body balance or stay upright when in an unstable position.

children.name: Dynamic Strength
children.description: The ability to exert muscle force repeatedly or continuously over time. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue.

children.name: Explosive Strength
children.description: The ability to use short bursts of muscle force to propel oneself (as in jumping or sprinting), or to throw an object.

children.name: Stamina
children.description: The ability to exert yourself physically over long periods of time without getting winded or out of breath.

children.name: Static Strength
children.description: The ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects.

children.name: Trunk Strength
children.description: The ability to use your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time without 'giving out' or fatiguing.

children.name: Auditory Attention
children.description: The ability to focus on a single source of sound in the presence of other distracting sounds.

children.name: Hearing Sensitivity
children.description: The ability to detect or tell the differences between sounds that vary in pitch and loudness.

children.name: Sound Localization
children.description: The ability to tell the direction from which a sound originated.

children.name: Speech Clarity
children.description: The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

children.name: Speech Recognition
children.description: The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.

children.name: Depth Perception
children.description: The ability to judge which of several objects is closer or farther away from you, or to judge the distance between you and an object.

children.name: Far Vision
children.description: The ability to see details at a distance.

children.name: Glare Sensitivity
children.description: The ability to see objects in the presence of glare or bright lighting.

children.name: Near Vision
children.description: The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).

children.name: Night Vision
children.description: The ability to see under low light conditions.

children.name: Peripheral Vision
children.description: The ability to see objects or movement of objects to one's side when the eyes are looking ahead.

children.name: Visual Color Discrimination
children.description: The ability to match or detect differences between colors, including shades of color and brightness.

children.name: English Language
children.description: Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.

children.name: Fine Arts
children.description: Knowledge of the theory and techniques required to compose, produce, and perform works of music, dance, visual arts, drama, and sculpture.

children.name: Foreign Language
children.description: Knowledge of the structure and content of a foreign (non-English) language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition and grammar, and pronunciation.

children.name: History and Archeology
children.description: Knowledge of historical events and their causes, indicators, and effects on civilizations and cultures.

children.name: Philosophy and Theology
children.description: Knowledge of different philosophical systems and religions. This includes their basic principles, values, ethics, ways of thinking, customs, practices, and their impact on human culture.

children.name: Administration and Management
children.description: Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.

children.name: Clerical
children.description: Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, stenography and transcription, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.

children.name: Customer and Personal Service
children.description: Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

children.name: Economics and Accounting
children.description: Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.

children.name: Personnel and Human Resources
children.description: Knowledge of principles and procedures for personnel recruitment, selection, training, compensation and benefits, labor relations and negotiation, and personnel information systems.

children.name: Sales and Marketing
children.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services. This includes marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems.

children.name: Communications and Media
children.description: Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.

children.name: Telecommunications
children.description: Knowledge of transmission, broadcasting, switching, control, and operation of telecommunications systems.

children.name: Education and Training
children.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects.

children.name: Building and Construction
children.description: Knowledge of materials, methods, and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures such as highways and roads.

children.name: Computers and Electronics
children.description: Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.

children.name: Design
children.description: Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.

children.name: Engineering and Technology
children.description: Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.

children.name: Mechanical
children.description: Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance.

children.name: Medicine and Dentistry
children.description: Knowledge of the information and techniques needed to diagnose and treat human injuries, diseases, and deformities. This includes symptoms, treatment alternatives, drug properties and interactions, and preventive health-care measures.

children.name: Therapy and Counseling
children.description: Knowledge of principles, methods, and procedures for diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of physical and mental dysfunctions, and for career counseling and guidance.

children.name: Law and Government
children.description: Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.

children.name: Public Safety and Security
children.description: Knowledge of relevant equipment, policies, procedures, and strategies to promote effective local, state, or national security operations for the protection of people, data, property, and institutions.

children.name: Food Production
children.description: Knowledge of techniques and equipment for planting, growing, and harvesting food products (both plant and animal) for consumption, including storage/handling techniques.

children.name: Production and Processing
children.description: Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods.

children.name: Biology
children.description: Knowledge of plant and animal organisms, their tissues, cells, functions, interdependencies, and interactions with each other and the environment.

children.name: Chemistry
children.description: Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods.

children.name: Geography
children.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for describing the features of land, sea, and air masses, including their physical characteristics, locations, interrelationships, and distribution of plant, animal, and human life.

children.name: Mathematics
children.description: Knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and their applications.

children.name: Physics
children.description: Knowledge and prediction of physical principles, laws, their interrelationships, and applications to understanding fluid, material, and atmospheric dynamics, and mechanical, electrical, atomic and sub- atomic structures and processes.

children.name: Psychology
children.description: Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; learning and motivation; psychological research methods; and the assessment and treatment of behavioral and affective disorders.

children.name: Sociology and Anthropology
children.description: Knowledge of group behavior and dynamics, societal trends and influences, human migrations, ethnicity, cultures and their history and origins.

children.name: Transportation
children.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for moving people or goods by air, rail, sea, or road, including the relative costs and benefits.

children.name: Estimating the Quantifiable Characteristics of Products, Events, or Information
children.description: Estimating sizes, distances, and quantities; or determining time, costs, resources, or materials needed to perform a work activity.

children.name: Getting Information
children.description: Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.

children.name: Identifying Objects, Actions, and Events
children.description: Identifying information by categorizing, estimating, recognizing differences or similarities, and detecting changes in circumstances or events.

children.name: Inspecting Equipment, Structures, or Material
children.description: Inspecting equipment, structures, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects.

children.name: Monitor Processes, Materials, or Surroundings
children.description: Monitoring and reviewing information from materials, events, or the environment, to detect or assess problems.

children.name: Monitoring and Controlling Resources
children.description: Monitoring and controlling resources and overseeing the spending of money.

children.name: Performing Administrative Activities
children.description: Performing day-to-day administrative tasks such as maintaining information files and processing paperwork.

children.name: Staffing Organizational Units
children.description: Recruiting, interviewing, selecting, hiring, and promoting employees in an organization.

children.name: Assisting and Caring for Others
children.description: Providing personal assistance, medical attention, emotional support, or other personal care to others such as coworkers, customers, or patients.

children.name: Communicating with Persons Outside Organization
children.description: Communicating with people outside the organization, representing the organization to customers, the public, government, and other external sources. This information can be exchanged in person, in writing, or by telephone or e-mail.

children.name: Communicating with Supervisors, Peers, or Subordinates
children.description: Providing information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.

children.name: Establishing and Maintaining Interpersonal Relationships
children.description: Developing constructive and cooperative working relationships with others, and maintaining them over time.

children.name: Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others
children.description: Translating or explaining what information means and how it can be used.

children.name: Performing for or Working Directly with the Public
children.description: Performing for people or dealing directly with the public. This includes serving customers in restaurants and stores, and receiving clients or guests.

children.name: Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others
children.description: Handling complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others.

children.name: Selling or Influencing Others
children.description: Convincing others to buy merchandise/goods or to otherwise change their minds or actions.

children.name: Coaching and Developing Others
children.description: Identifying the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.

children.name: Coordinating the Work and Activities of Others
children.description: Getting members of a group to work together to accomplish tasks.

children.name: Developing and Building Teams
children.description: Encouraging and building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.

children.name: Guiding, Directing, and Motivating Subordinates
children.description: Providing guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.

children.name: Provide Consultation and Advice to Others
children.description: Providing guidance and expert advice to management or other groups on technical, systems-, or process-related topics.

children.name: Training and Teaching Others
children.description: Identifying the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing others.

children.name: Analyzing Data or Information
children.description: Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.

children.name: Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards
children.description: Using relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards.

children.name: Judging the Qualities of Things, Services, or People
children.description: Assessing the value, importance, or quality of things or people.

children.name: Processing Information
children.description: Compiling, coding, categorizing, calculating, tabulating, auditing, or verifying information or data.

children.name: Developing Objectives and Strategies
children.description: Establishing long-range objectives and specifying the strategies and actions to achieve them.

children.name: Making Decisions and Solving Problems
children.description: Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

children.name: Organizing, Planning, and Prioritizing Work
children.description: Developing specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.

children.name: Scheduling Work and Activities
children.description: Scheduling events, programs, and activities, as well as the work of others.

children.name: Thinking Creatively
children.description: Developing, designing, or creating new applications, ideas, relationships, systems, or products, including artistic contributions.

children.name: Updating and Using Relevant Knowledge
children.description: Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.

children.name: Documenting/Recording Information
children.description: Entering, transcribing, recording, storing, or maintaining information in written or electronic/magnetic form.

children.name: Drafting, Laying Out, and Specifying Technical Devices, Parts, and Equipment
children.description: Providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used.

children.name: Interacting With Computers
children.description: Using computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information.

children.name: Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment
children.description: Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing machines, devices, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic (not mechanical) principles.

children.name: Repairing and Maintaining Mechanical Equipment
children.description: Servicing, repairing, adjusting, and testing machines, devices, moving parts, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of mechanical (not electronic) principles.

children.name: Controlling Machines and Processes
children.description: Using either control mechanisms or direct physical activity to operate machines or processes (not including computers or vehicles).

children.name: Handling and Moving Objects
children.description: Using hands and arms in handling, installing, positioning, and moving materials, and manipulating things.

children.name: Operating Vehicles, Mechanized Devices, or Equipment
children.description: Running, maneuvering, navigating, or driving vehicles or mechanized equipment, such as forklifts, passenger vehicles, aircraft, or water craft.

children.name: Performing General Physical Activities
children.description: Performing physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials.
